reviews.review_msg: I loved her class! Best class I have taken thus far in University!!! Must take!! Be creative and participate. It is fun! I would actually take this class again!! I had no idea what education was coming in, but she truly changed my mind!
very good prof?very nice and helpful

Dr. Bai is an amazing teacher! She is very passionate about teaching and probably one of the kindest professors I have had. She really makes an effort to promote discussion, which only makes class more interesting.I would highly recommend taking a class with her.

He very helpful, offers office hours, have in class discussions.  You won't feel boring during the 2-hour lecture.  He has clear grading criteria, and he gives feedback on your writing.  Only 500 words portfolio, no long essay! Attendance matters, need to sign the attendance sheets.

The class was very straightforward, if you did what is requested of you then you'll do well. Lilach makes everything clear and is open to questions. LOTS of class discussions. Some topics were interesting some were very boring. Overall an okay class with simple assignments.
Professor Schmidt is super chill and easygoing, and is really flexible with deadlines. Easiest course I've taken, minimum effort will still get you a good mark.
Really chill professor. Take EDUC100W with her if you have the opportunity, it's one of the best electives you can take for the sake of your mental health.

The course is well structured, with a module for each week's content. Ample time is given for writing assignments which are graded fairly. Her rubrics are super clear. You do have to be willing to share personal experiences for good marks on the discussions and the WalkAbout (a presentation of yourself). Quizzes are easy if you read the textbook.

TAKE. THIS. CLASS. Grading scale is brutal (98-100 is an A+) but absolutely doable if you put in the time. Literally the best professor at SFU. Super nice and caring and actually understands that you are a student and not a robot.
LIT CLASS TAKE IT !!!
great time with her in this course if you keep up with upcoming schedule

Easy class and honestly very interesting! Get ready to read as there is quite a lot, but its all focused on positionality and social construct, which I enjoyed. NOT FOR EVERYONE - if you can't see yourself reflecting and connecting with topics like this, I do not recommend, as I've seen this drag down GPA for those who lose interest.

Michele is an amazing professor, and she cares about her students a lot. I would highly recommend this class to anyone who wants to increase their GPA! The TAs mark easily—as long as you follow the rubric, you are good. You are guaranteed to get an A in this class! I took this course with her in the Summer of 2024.
The course is structured with weekly readings and the rubric for assignment/graded activities are clear. She is super helpful and happy to help solve an issues that you may run into.
Amazing professor, understanding and will help you succeed. EDU100 is a very easy course taking with Professor Schmidt

Michele is very kind. I'm not going into Education but took EDUC 100W to boost my GPA and It for sure did. The assignments and discussions were easy but they did get personal as we were asked to share about our lives. If you're open and caring then this class will not only be a breeze but it will be fun.

This class was great! I learned a good amount about the education sector and I appreciated the learning topics. As a Crim student, I took this as a Breadth credit and I totally recommend it. Participation matters and I would skim the textbook and lectures. The papers are easy if you follow instructions and the prof is so sweet and kind. TAKE IT!!

Michele was nice and obviously cared about students. She responded well to questions and comments and came up with interesting projects. She marks really easily too, so as long as you kind of follow the rubric and participate in class, you're almost guaranteed an A+.
The best professor I've ever had! Really cares about her students. This is the first class I've really genuinely enjoyed taking at SFU!

Michèle cares about her students and it is shown in the way she teaches. She is flexible with due dates and makes sure that the grading criteria is clear through her rubrics. This class is interesting because groups take turns teaching a chapter every week. She is willing to give extra credit. This class is chill and I am glad I took it. Easy A!

I enjoyed this prof, she made the class very enjoyable, was caring and made it a great learning environment, she really does care about her students' grades and is approachable. Take this class as an elective. You do have to attend all classes, but overall, she is very lenient and informed about education
This prof is really chill and caring. But she started getting tougher for the final paper.
i believe that michael is the most impactful and inspiring human. everyone should take a class with him.

Very inspirational Professor who is caring towards his students, willing to help support our learning whenever possible. He helped broaden my views on Education-as a way of life and that everyone have their own potential & Identity. He had taught us many valuable gems of Education and I will definitely take another course with him!

Wonderful seminar class! Michael asks students to dig into what they are personally interested in in relation to education. Very interesting in terms of material, as Michael brings forward his thoughts alongside the students'. A very caring and knowledgeable professor that makes university experience a little brighter.

I love this class! Really inspiring & changes the way you view education & what a good life means to you.  This is one of my fav classes + I'm in business.  He's the type of teacher every teacher should be.  Michael is a great person his positive energy just rubs off on you. Good grade regardless, so he focuses on you actually learning something

Michael is one of the most thoughtful and caring people I've ever met. He genuinely tries to reach out to every student and our 3 hour lectures flew by fast. Loved this class so much. Take it with him if you have the chance, you will not regret it!

Not only is it important to attend lectures it is also fun! Michaels lectures are engaging and he is enthusiastic about education and make you want to come to class to hear what he will say. He makes an effort to get to know each student and encourages participation in class. I wish I could take this course again.

Michael is an amazing prof. He's such a great conversationalist and his lectures draw from a vast collection of experience and knowledge. He really gets you thinking about the big questions. 100% approachable. Gets to know every student. Would take again.
He's the BEST professor I have ever had! Genuinely cares about his students, and he makes his class so interesting! 10/10 Would take again

Michael is absolutely amazing. He is so passionate and open-minded which makes his class fantastic. He genuinely cares about his students and he is very understanding of the stressful life of university students. Great class and great prof.
nice profs
Greatest teacher ever. If only all professors at SFU were like him.

One of the greatest professors. He is far from the other professors @ SFU. He makes you think critically about education and world view o.  Really emphasizes what a teacher is, he has made open my eyes to teaching, learning and the overall scope of education  Greatest teacher at SFU. Period. Would take him again

Michael is an amazing professor in addition to being an extraordinarily kind, caring and passionate human being. He always treated the students as equals and makes you feel as though you matter. His realness is comforting and allows you to be real as well. I recommend absolutely any class that Michael teaches.
Nice choice for this course! Great Prof...
He is by far the best prof ever. i took his class at SFU surrey and it was amazing.. I would highly recommend him.very fair and easy marker!!

Marela is like a friend morso than a prof. She is super kind and will discuss how the lecture material correlates to our everyday lives. Half the time you end up having deep discussions. Participation is important and highly encouraged. If you want a chill/vibey class, she is amazing. I took the class synchronously online.

Dr Maclean is an excellent lecturer. She inspires students and is very accommodating to classroom discussions. Topics covered in class sparked students interest which motivated students to do the readings and weekly written reflections . Research Essay was a great idea as we could research into any topic of education that we found to be of interest
The best prof that helped me a lot. 100/10
She is an amazing prof and is always trying to inspire her students. She gives great feedback on assignments and the overall workload is light. I recommend taking a class with her

Her class felt like a total joke. Although the content was very easy I feel I didn't actually learn anything about education and how to be a teacher. All we did was write poems in the woods and do improv. There was no real lecturing happening.

I took EDUC 100W with Celeste and it was AMAZING!!! She is my favourite prof and she cares so much about each student. The course allows you to be creative and demonstrate education in anyway. I enjoyed all the field trips and class discussions. Loved this class so much and I will miss it!

Michelle's class was very innovative and also engaging. She's a very understanding prof (also usually laughing with the class) who makes it easier to come to class. Nothing bad to say about her, prob the best class and best prof I will ever take!!

Was excited to take the course based on reviews. Not sure if it's just this semester, but I really wish I didn't take it - or that I took it in class. Instructions for the assignments are so incredibly vague. Seriously, no indication of what the TAs are looking for. My academic writing is quite strong, but this course has been a nightmare so far

This was a distance education class, where your TA mainly runs the course. The class was fairly easy, though it can be time consuming and the instructions were not always clear. It is 50% portfolios and 50% group discussions, where you write 500 words for each, and no exams. If you can write an APA formatted essay, it is a GPA booster.

It's online so it's more about the TA; you never even meet Allan. 50% weekly portfolios of 500 words, 50% online dicussion. It's 1h worth of work per week. If you can write a basic essay with citations you'll get an A
I found this class quite boring, but it was super easy, took very little time each weekm and fulfilled my humanities requirement so I don't regret taking it.

BEST PROF EVER! Bing is very outside the box, easygoing, friendly and approachable. His instructions/assignments can be unclear at times, but if you show up, ask questions and make an effort, you won't regret it. His lectures are half academic, half storytelling - always interesting. I would recommend everyone take a class with him!

He was very passionate about what we were learning. At first I didn't think I would enjoy the class but after a while I really enjoyed the subject and thought he did well. Sometimes he jumped all over the place but it was a nice easy class!

This class was the easiest A I've ever gotten in university. He is very passionate about what he teaches, even though sometimes it is unclear what he's trying say. He says the odd weird thing, but a very nice guy and good prof. Plus he's the easiest marker I've ever had.

I've been lucky enough to have Cary as a prof for EDUC100W, 252W, and 352W. I can't recommend him enough. He is very responsive to emails and really cares about his students. One of the best profs I've ever had at SFU. The material can be a lot to digest and doesn't always make sense right away, but it is really interesting overall. 10/10
Not amazing, contradicts himself when asked on make up assignments. Marking system is not the best, gives not so great feedback on assignments.

Cary was such an engaging professor that seemed to enjoy teaching and talking with the students in the class. It was a pleasure to attend his class and I enjoyed it immensely. The homework he gives is extremely helpful and he is a very fair grader. Additionally, he gives very in-depth feedback. I would 100% recommend taking this class.

Cary genuinely wants his students to succeed and puts extensive effort into ensuring we feel safe and comfortable! His passion for teaching translates into the course w/ detailed weekly emails, clarifying videos, and fascinating personal insight in modules. His teaching style truly changed my education (for once, I felt valued as a student!). 10/10

Cary is extremely kind and understanding. EDUC 100W is an easy course, but it requires a lot of reading and a fair amount of effort. Cary truly cares about his students and is very passionate about the course topics. Highly recommend!

Dr. Campbell is honestly one of the most amazing profs I've ever had. Many people take EDUC100W as a floater, GPA boost course but this has been one of the most enriching courses that I've ever taken. The course materials have definitely helped grow my own personal opinions and allowed me to grow morally. Cary is incredibly caring and accommodating

Cary is a fantastic prof! Learned so much in this class and had a lot of fun doing it. He makes his material so fun and interesting that the three hours in the class fly by. If you ever get a chance to have him you're lucky!!
Probably the best professor in education. Very easy going, fun, and caring for his students. Seminars are fun and eye-opening, and don't feel like the full 3 hours.

He is a very strange prof but pretty flexible about deadlines if you have a solid excuse. He is pretty caring towards the students compared to other teachers. If you have ADHD do not take this course because you will get lost in the sauce.
Very easy course, however, the engagement from the professor is low. I had no idea how my performance was in the class as half our grades were not marked until after the semester.

Michelle herself taught absolutely nothing in this course. The course is all paper readings, so all she did was send two welcome announcements. Discussions are bloated with fake enthusiasm and most of the time they go nowhere actually novel. The readings are all politically biased. Course itself is easy, as long as you emulate said fake enthusiasm.
Focus on your own reflections from your experiences. Contribute in group discussions.

I think it's ridiculous that a professor who never replies to emails and gave you a low grade has the nerve to tell me what to do. Her course is really boring and disorganized. She even got the assignment deadline wrong. It feels like a complete waste of time to put effort into this course.

I will never forgive her for not rounding my grade to the A+ I deserved. Had multiple meetings about course content and how to do better on assignments. As other people have said, it's mostly useless progressive teaching methods that do not work in the real world. Just agree with what she wants you to say and get a good grade. Not a fun class.

This prof is very unorganized and seems like it is her first course she's ever taught (EDUC 352W). Modules and material are locked and she forgets to unlock them until midweek. She also never replies to emails. Overall if you are someone who likes to stay ahead, this course will frustrate you. Don't take with her!
Prof barely grades on time. The readings are long but also very RANDOM and strange topics. It's very bias. Take the info with a grain of salt. Make up some bs tbh.

I am just going to say it... I took this class with Michelle a while back and would never take another class with her again. Everything you "learn" is basically far-left propaganda/fascist woke culture and is insanely politically biased. Most alienating experience ever. Got an A+ and still know that everything I said in class was complete bogus :)

This prof grades things so late so u have no idea what u did wrong. In the submissions, they dont tell u what u get deducted for which is frustrating. sorta a GPA booster but only if ur decent at writing from the beginning. She also never replies to emails. not tech savvy.

TBH grading was somewhat clear. Shes hard to reach via email. I always emailed the TAs. BUT participation matters. I only spent abt 2-3 hours a week on this class. Lots of opportunities for extra credit. Tbh if ur put into a good group that contributes youll be ok. Just be very aware of deadlines. Dont fall behind.

Do not take this class as a GPA booster, but rather learn from it. Dr. Nilson provides incredible resources to challenges students' thinking and bring overlooked perspectives in the course. She made the course delivery easy with the opportunity to actual interact with the materials. Highly recommend!

Easy class but she is very lazy. Students should expect feedback months after the submission. If you made the same mistake in subsequent submissions you will get deducted multiple times. Half the time they didn't even provide any feedback on how to improve they just deducted marks without any explanation.
Rly kind teacher, and trust me, if u need a class to boost your gpa, take this online class but the online class gets full rly fast , its so easy
Very kind, cares about the success of her students, and interesting content!

In EDUC 100W a lot of the interaction is with the TA but when Dr. Nilson marked assignments/discussions her feedback was very kind and inspirational. She also gave us plenty of time to complete assignments and extended due dates a couple times.
